citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: The 1998 Alberta Survey (AS) was the eleventh annual provincial survey administered by the Population Research Laboratory (PRL). This omnibus style survey of households in the province of Alberta has enabled academic researchers, government departments, non-profit organizations, and the private sector to explore a wide range of research topics in a structured research framework.

Author.author:Name: Population Research Laboratory
Author.author:Affiliation: Department of Sociology, University of Alberta.

ore:describes.Title: Alberta Survey, 1998
ore:describes.socialscience:Estimates of Sampling Erro: Survey estimates for the total sample of 1,202 are accurate within plus or minus 2.9 percentage points, 19 times out of 20
ore:describes.socialscience:Actions to Minimize Losses: Supervisors monitor call dispositions, field edit, validate and accumulate data for analysis.
ore:describes.socialscience:Response Rate: The overall response rate for the 1998 Alberta Survey was 58%.
Subject: Arts and Humanities
Social Sciences
ore:describes.socialscience:Sampling Procedure:
SAMPLING DESIGN Main Features of Design: a. Province of Alberta was delineated into three areas for telephone interviewing. (1) City of Edmonton. (2) City of Calgary. (3) Remainder of the Province (Other Alberta). b. Two-stage selection process. (1) Selection of households. (2) Selection of respondent within each household. To permit the analysis of each area as a separate entity, a minimum sample size of 400 or more for each area of the province was deemed necessary. The target population designated for telephone interviewing was all persons 18 years of age or older who, at the time of the survey, were living in a dwelling unit in Alberta that could be contacted by direct-dialing. From this population, three samples were drawn to cover Alberta: the City of Edmonton (EAS) , the City of Calgary, and the rest of the province. A random-digit dialing approach was used to ensure that respondents had an equal chance to be contacted whether or not their household was listed in a telephone directory. The PRL has developed a database of five-digit telephone banks (i.e. 403-xxx-xx) covering all of Alberta. The database is updated regularly and used for generating the survey sample. The 1998 Alberta Survey sample was drawn from the telephone database by using a computer program to select, with replacement, a simple random sample of banks for each area and appending a random number between 00 and 99 to each number selected. All duplicate telephone numbers were purged from the computer-generated list. Nursing homes and collective dwellings were also deleted from the sample. Within the household, one eligible person was selected as the respondent for the twenty-minute interview. A respondent within each household was selected on the basis of gender using the following selection guidelines to ensure an equal selection of male and female participants. a. The dwelling unit must be the person's usual place of residence and he/she must be 18 years of age or older. b. If an adult male answers the phone and is willing to be interviewed, he is the
respondent. c. If an adult female answers the phone and there is an adult male present who is willing to be interviewed, interview the male. If the male is not willing to be interviewed, and the female is willing, interview the female. d. If an adult female answers the phone and there is no adult male present, choose her as the respondent
ore:describes.socialscience:Universe: The target population designated for telephone interviewing was all persons 18 years of age or older who, at the time of the survey, were living in a dwelling unit in Alberta that could be contacted by direct-dialling. From this population, three samples were drawn to cover Alberta: the City of Edmonton (EAS), the City of Calgary, and the rest of the province.
ore:describes.socialscience:Weighting: The weighting factors used for the 1998 survey are as follows:Edmonton 0.713910; Calgary 0.881811; Other Alberta 1.403566
ore:describes.schema:name: Alberta Survey, 1998
ore:describes.dvcore:conditions: No attempt should be made to disclose individuals in the study nor link records through study with other files.
